As LC stated below, you have to take three steps to make it work:
1. install app
2. install 'ibus preferences' , add 'Chinese (intelligent pinyin)' in input
3. go to system settings, in 'Region & Language', add input sources ' Chinese (intelligent pinyin).
Bingo!

ok so the CRUTIAL thing is you install "gnome tweaks" 
1. launch gnome tweaks
2. go to "keyboard & mouse"
3. toggle on "show extended input sources"

now it will appear in your settings
4. open settings
5. "Language and Region"
6. in input sources click the + button to add the "Chinese (intelligent Pinyin)" 
7. 享受你的拼音键盘

description:
1. On Ubuntu 20.04, to open IBus Preferences UI:
$ ibus-setup

2. Then add 'Chinese-Intelligent Pinyin' under Input Method tab.

3. Go to settings, under Region & Language, click the ‘+’ button under Input Sources, then add ‘Chinese (Intelligent Pinyin). To use change to Pinyin input, press Super+Space key.

description: Do not need this, why is it here and why there's no uninstall option???????

I'm using Ubuntu 22.04. Here are the steps:
1. Open terminal, run "ibus-setup" to open ibus preferences.
2. Go to "Input Method" tab and click "add". Choose "Chinese" - "Intelligent Pinyin". Close IBus Preferences
3. In Activities, search "Settings" and open it. Go to Keyboard. Click "+" in "Input Sources". Choose "Chinese" - "Chinese (Intelligent Pinyin)".

Now Pinyin should be available. You just need to change the keyboard by using super key (windows key) + space key

summary: 需要手动添加拼音输入法才可以用

description: 要在设置-keyboard-输入源，点+号，弹出页面点三个点载入更多，往下滚到中间偏上的位置，选中汉语(中国)，跳转页面选中文(智能拼音)点添加。添加完成点三个点设置move up到第一个。然后重启，系统右上角关机那里多出一个“中”的图标。打字的时候单击shift切换中英文。
